headline: Focaccia Bread
description: This homemade focaccia bread is a delicious alternative to garlic bread. Lots of herbs, Parmesan, and mozzarella cheese means lots of flavor!

video.description: See how to make quick-and-easy flatbread flavored with garlic and herbs.
video.name: Focaccia Bread

name: Focaccia Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Combine flour, yeast, salt, sugar, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, basil, and black pepper in a large bowl. Add water and vegetable oil, then mix until dough comes together.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic.
Lightly oil a large bowl; place the dough in the bowl and turn to coat with oil. Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place for 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.
Punch dough down and place on prepared baking sheet. Pat into a 1/2 inch thick rectangle. Brush top with olive oil and sprinkle with mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Cut into 12 pieces and serve warm.

review.reviewBody: I love this recipe. I make it all the time at work and it goes over great!! I bump up the seasonings just a bit and I definitely proof the yeast with the water, sugar and salt before adding it to the dough. I let it rise for 20 minutes, punch it down and form it back into a ball before letting it rise another 20 minutes. I just put as much cheese on it as I feel like at the moment lol
Added olives and sprayed olive oil on the toppings before and after baking. Smells and tastes fantastic

loved it, I was using yeast so I knew to use warm (it should be in the instructions). I am not i Italian sooooo I do not know what real focaccia bread is...My family digs it. I love and even use it for pizza crust for "upside down pizza"
Super yummy added olives and garlic confit on top!
I love this recipe! So easy and good. I add extra herbs and garlic, and I also, put a few veggies on top. Sooo good, I've been using this recipe for years!

This is probably the worst recipe I have made. I followed the recipe to the tee (twice) and both times the dough was dense and did not rise. There is no way I cup of water is enough for 2 3/4 cup of flour. Also, the recipe does not mention that you should use warm water.
I am not Italian so I wasn't sure if I made it right but it was sure good. We had it with barbeque meatballs.

This was really good. Much better than the commercial focaccia breads. I added fresh herbs from the garden (parsley, sage, rosemary and... basil) to the yeast during the final stages of my bread machine's mixing cycle. I also used fresh garlic, rather than dried. I used the baked bread with another terrific recipe on this site, Grilled Mediterranean Vegetable Sandwich. Update: after a very long absence, I made this again. It's still a favorite. However, I made a dumb mistake and baked the dough directly on parchment paper. It caused the bread to fuse with the paper! ðŸ˜¯. Next time, I'll follow the directions and bake it on a greased baking sheet.
this was so easy! And so so tasty!
Delicious herb bread but NOT a foccacia bread. I had my suspicions when the dough wasn't a lovely wet mess. If you are wanting a traditional foccacia, skip this recipe or you'll be disappointed.

The instructions and recipe were terrific. I have never made any kind of bread before and it turned out as it should. Instead of the olive topping, I used kosher salt, basil, oregano and onion powder. My family loved it.
the amount of water that is called for did not make my dough as sticky. if I would make again would hold back 1/2 cup of flour and use if needed.

I made this recipe exactly as shown, AND, another without the spices (just salt on top). I was making two different dishes, one was spicy, and I thought the plain focaccia would compliment that dish better. I couldn't have been more pleased! It was so easy to make, and I got a lot of compliments. The only thing I did differently in the prep, was digging in with my fingers when shaping it, and sprinkling olive oil liberally on top, not brushing. 
I made them early in the afternoon, baked them, cooled on a wire rack, put a thin dishtowel over them, and then lightly reheated them before serving. Delicious!
Really easy and delicious!

Really fast and quite easy. This can serve as a foundation as once you get it to the baking pan stage your can play with it. Iâ€™ve used mixes of smoked cheeses, chopped fresh herbs and bacon bits. Maybe not that traditional but very delicious

This is a great bread to have with any Italian food. Or even just a bowl of simple marinara. I've served it with Spaghetti, Lasagna, and Scallops in a tomato-basil sauce. Went great with all. It's quick, easy, and I used my rocker knife to slice it into bread strips. Or just tear a chunk off. One note, the first time you make it, watch it so the cheese on top doesn't get too brown. Gonna be a regular for me!
this is the easiest bread! We use it to make homemade pizzas. soooo good!
Just read most of the comments! Great recipe

Delicious and easy. Don't proof the yeast, just follow the recipe and it will come out perfectly!! I omitted the thyme though because my family doesn't like that herb and I don't prefer mozzarella on mine. Ready to dip in some oil!!
Wish the recipe would be updated to indicate warm water needs to be used. My bread did not turn out the way I expected it to. Bummer! Now I know about the warm water.

Excellent and super easy! I have made this several times and each time itâ€™s gets better and better!!
Thank you.
Absolutely delicious! So easy to make. I used kosher salt on the top before baking and it was perfect. This is a keeper.

Followed the recipe exactly. Iâ€™m not a baker AT ALL so I was afraid to stray from how it was written. It is delicious and my husband is currently dipping in olive oil and balsamic. I am very proud that my afraid-of-yeast-and-proofing self pulled this off. Thank you for the recipe! And for the reviewer tips like not using a metal bowl; I had no idea. A keeper!
Awesome, easily split open for a great sandwich

This recipe is so good! I've never had any luck with making any type of bread, so I was worried about how this would turn out. The recipe was simple and the bread turned out beautifully. I was SO excited! Even my Italian husband loved it!
Very easy to make! My family loved it!
the dough was really tough and dry
Bread turns out incredibly dense..

This recipe is bomb! I make this recipe for my family every other week and it is AMAZING each and every time. We have made it into different shapes, we have made it into breadsticks by rolling it out before putting it into the oven we also have done biscuits by, rolling little balls of dough and cooking it. The biggest hit with this bread ( other than by itself with soup ) is homemade pizza. I make a pizza shape and cook it for 10 minutes then take it out and put sauce and topping on and cook it for another 5 minutes. It truly is delicious and a definite keep for the rest of my life. Leaving it in the oven (or other warm place) for a couple hours really helped how it turned out and rise before I cooked it in the oven. It is really simple and fun to make with, common spices and quick timing. Our family loves it!
I live in the Middle East and have never had to make focaccia before, but with Covid we are in lockdown a lot and the restaurants are not operating at full capacity.

Followed the recipe exactly as written. 
Loved it!!!!

Easy, versatile dough but do use warm 110-120 water and sugar to activate yeast before combining all. I used stand mixer for all, before proofing first time. Refrigerated it after punching down, then put on oiled pan for second rise of about 30 minutes. Then baked. Really tasty for focaccia or pizza dough! Thanks for recipe!
Not bad for being such a quick bread recipe! It turned out pretty good. I just think it should be proving longer in winter time.
Our favorite bread recipe. My 11yo loves to make it and use it a pizza crust!

This was so easy and came out perfectly. I proofed my yeast with the water and sugar before mixing in the other ingredients. It was perfect as a side to the tomato based soup we had for dinner. Iâ€™ll definitely make it again and try some new flavor combinations!

Loved this recipe (and the advice of the creators in the Comments--proofing the yeast was smart). It's easy enough to do on a Sunday morning and decorate as a first try at "Garden Focaccia." Tasty, simple, and pretty quick to make.

Excellent bread.
Turned out perfect.
My husband couldnâ€™t stop eating it. lol
Simple, easy to tweak... I added fresh basil and chopped garlic to the top before baking. Next time I will add sweet peppers and sun-dried tomatoes! Great little recipe!
Can't wait to try this at the end of the month when I can purchase the herbs! I use rapid rise yeast, so there is NO need to proof it. My breads always turns out great.
great recipe, would recommend adding rosemary and another rising.

Excellent & simple recipe as long as you proof your yeast with sugar & warm water (110-115 degrees). Dough needs a tiny bit more salt. Will add 1/4 t. next time.
Once dough was pressed onto baking sheet, I used all my fingers to 'dimple' the top. Then I added more rosemary, but any herb could be used. So glad I made it...a new family favorite.
Easy Peasy. If you fear yeast dough, do not fear. Adorn with your favourite flavours. You will be rewarded.
Family favorite! I tried it both as written and following suggestions, both were great.

This recipe is only easy to follow if you already have experience with baking with yeast.
I added another 1/2 tsp of salt, left out the mozzarella completely and it still turned out delicious! I recommend decorating it with pumpkin and poppy seeds because after they roast they give a really nice flavor. My family loved it.
I put 6oz of shredded Mozzarella and give or take a large pinch of Shredded Parmesan. SUPER cheesy! Lol

No cheese
Add yeast to warm water with honey instead of sugar instead of putting it in the flour
Bake with rosemary on top
Tasted good. However needed a little more water and much longer time to rest. Also I would not cover with damp towel. Let sit in bowl in warm place.
I used pepper, paprika, Munster cheese and bagel topping for a smokey, savory addition to broccoli cheddar soup. the bread was gone by the end of the night!
So easy and flavourful! I added roasted roma tomatoes on top. Brilliant flavour! You have to make this bread!

I don't make homemade breads often so I'm a novice with the how-to of bread making. Saying that, this was incredibly easy and turned out fantastic! I made it as written, didn't change a thing and everyone loved it. It was a perfect match to the zuppa tuscana I made.

Great!! The recipe definitely needs to include the proofing of the bread in the instructions because it is a necessary step. Also I added a little extra salt which I think makes it better. I enjoyed it!

Have made this several times. It is adaptable with respect to toppings, sun dried tomatoes, olives, parm, mozzarella, pepperoni, ham, onions, pizza sauce, etc. I usually divide the dough and freeze one and serve one, because it is more than enough for two people. Easy peasy. Also tried Tuscan Sun spice mix from Penzeyâ€™s in-the bread, and that was a nice flavor.
Turned out delicious! I followed other reviewers' advice by cutting the garlic powder by half and allowing for a second rise. Rolled into a circle and baked on my pizza stone.

Super easy recipe and tastes great.
I will definitely make this again
Easy and yummy!
Wonderful! Iâ€™ve made this a couple of times. This last time I used rosemary instead of called for herbs. Yummy!
The perfect texture for sandwiches!
I did every step and used all ingredients and was pretty disappointed as it turned out more like a regular pizza than a focaccia pizza.
Made it w/ 1 cup wheat flour subbed for white flour. The family liked it.

This was fool proof, which I need. The only thing I did different was use fresh herbs as I had them in the garden and I eliminated the cheese because itâ€™s not my thing. But the basic recipe is easy and turned out like it should have.
I followed the recommendations of others and bloomed the yeast. I also followed the recommendation of more salt which I wish I HADNâ€™T followed. Iâ€™ll try again with the amount of salt called for.

Love this! Itâ€™s so quick & easy and DELICIOUS! My family loves it. Iâ€™ve made it 3 times in 2 weeks. I let it rise again after it has finished the first proof. I just spread it into my round stoneware pan and let it rise again for about 15 min before baking. Usually, I cut the cheese into little chunks and sink them and I like it with olives too! So good! You should try it!

Easy to follow and delicious flavor! The texture of the bread was a bit off in my opinion but this was my first time working with yeast so may be my technique. Overall, would recommend this recipe and Iâ€™ll definitely be trying it again.
Amazing! I used it for pizza.

So easy and so good!! The only change I made was to make 1 cup of the flour whole wheat and add a few kalamata olives to the top with an extra sprinkle of black pepper. Baked up so flavorful and moist! Absolutely going to make this again and agin.
My dough need to rise more, I left in bowl 25 minutes, it had no favor.

I made this following the recipe & incorporating a couple of the suggestions from reviewers. I subbed milk for water and didn't "bloom" the yeast. Unfortunately (rookie mistake on my part) I used milk straight out of the fridge & think that's why my bread didn't rise at all the first go-round. I gave it 20 more minutes to rise in the unheated oven with the light on & it got a little puffy, but not much. Then I punched down the little bit that had risen, flattened it, dimpled it, drizzled oil & salt on it & baked it in my cast iron skillet.

It came out fluffy & delicious with a crispy bottom, and it was a big hit with the family, but the texture was like a scone or biscuit, not focaccia. I am left wondering if it was a yeast issue or if maybe using bread flour would have given the usual texture. I also noticed the dough was quite dry as it was mixing, so maybe that had something to do with it. 

Next time I make it I will add some oil to the recipe, use bread flour, & make sure to let the yeast bloom, rather than adding it to the dry ingredients.

The bread came out tougher than the focaccia bread I was hoping for. The bottom got overly brown, and it tasted more like a biscuit than airy fluffy soft focaccia. The taste was ok, texture not what I wanted. Made two batches, one dough was stickier and came out a bit softer, but still more like a biscuit. I'm using SAF yeast.
added fresh rosemary to the mix - also after reading many reviews I decided not to proof the yeast as recipe suggested, I was a little nervous but it worked!
So easy and the house smells so fragrant!
Delicious and SUPER easy to make! Of all the focaccia bread recipes Iâ€™ve seen, this was easy to follow.

it was tasty but what a waste of cheese. recipe is too wet without it. I always proof / feed the yeast. use infused olive oil and fresh herbs for a more authentic taste. still looking for perfect recipe.

so easy and delicious! i followed the tip to let isnâ€™t rise another 20 minutes before putting in the oven. i also did that baker hack and put in an empty baking sheet while pre-heating the oven, then placed a few ice cubes on the heated sheet to add steam in the oven the while bread is baking. combination of those two tips gave me a lovely crispy light crust with airy bread. definitely making this again! next time i will play with some fresh herbs.

The recipe was great- however- if you're new to bread baking or maybe just aren't as experienced, make sure you proof your yeast first, and make sure your water is warm (between 105 and 115F). Once your water/yeast/sugar mixture is nice and bubbly (it was about 5-10 minutes for me), add it to your dry ingredients- this will help immensely later on in the recipe. Also, as a few other users have mentioned, after you punch down the dough after letting it rise, let it sit and rise again for another 30 minutes. :)

I am not knowledgeable about make bread but this turned out to be great. I used 2.5 teaspoons of Italian Seasonings instead of the seasonings in the recipe due to what I had in my pantry. I should have watched it closer because 15 minutes a a little too long. Luckily it was not burnt but it was certainly very close to burning. I cut off the edges and my kids (5,8) ate almost the whole bread.
I have made this bread so many times in a short amount of time. It is so quick, easy, and delicious. My significant other devours it every time I make it. Highly recommend!
Fantastic recipe. Super easy and my boys loved it.
delicious!
Mine never rose; good flavor but tough

Great recipe. Directions were rather sparse for those of us who don't usually bake bread. Fortunately other reviews added info so I did proof the yeast and it turned out great. Thanks! The family asked me to make it again.
Did not rise: 20 minutes isnâ€™t long enough. The Easy Foccacia is a better recipe.

Mine did not turn out well. I was very hopeful based off the positive reviews, but my bread did not rise well at all and turned out more like croutons. I think the dough needed to be hydrated more and had more time to rise.
Made it. They loved it.

I'm not a baker, but this recipe was SO EASY! And delicious! The reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it omitted using warm water with the yeast and letting the yeast prepare. I read another review that suggested doing this, as well as letting the dough rise twice. I think this was the ultimate secret to success. Next time I will press it a little thicker for the final product.
My kitchen, ohh how good it smells! I made this for tonight's Salmon Fettuccine.... can't wait!
Super easy to make. I used fresh herbs from my garden. Proofed mine for around 20 extra min. Will make this again.

This was absolutely delicious! I make many different types of bread and I have to say this will be a new go to bread. A few things I did differently was I used garlic salt instead of garlic powder, I mixed the yeast,sugar and hot water in a small bowl covered with plastic wrap for 10 minutes. I accidentally forgot to put the oil in. The bread turned out great and moist anyway.
Great recipe! Added black olives and doubled the salt.

Came out really good! Love the recipe!
Instructions left something to be desired though, ended up relying on other reviews.

Followed directions, very easy to make. I did not add the mozzarella cheese and it still was flavorful.. next time I would like to add some Greek olives slices to it. I will be making this again. Enjoy with your favorite dish and some wine

This is delicious will definitely make again. 
Made Mediterranean chicken pizza out if it and family loved it.
Made this to specs before I read the reviews. Defiantly came out flatter that I hoped. Next time I will proof my yeast. I chopped fresh rosemary and sprinkled that on with coarse salt before baking.
Made this to specs before I read the reviews. Defiantly came out flatter that I hoped. Next time I will proof my yeast. I chopped fresh rosemary and sprinkled that on with coarse salt before baking.

Disaster. Directions donâ€™t include proofing the yeast. Whatâ€™s the point of a recipe if I canâ€™t just follow it and have to make assumptions or change it? Iâ€™m upset that I wasted the ingredients on this poorly written recipe at a time when flour and yeast are so hard to come by (corona virus times). I wish I could give this minus stars.

An extremely easy recipe, and the aroma calls "HOME" from the kitchen. This lightly raised bread is almost a meal on its own, served warm with a small plate of EVOO, having that enticing green cast of a natural olive oil, along with freshly cracked black, or other colored, peppercorns of your choosing. Also great the next day with careful warming.

Yum! What a great recipe! As many reviews have stated, I made a few alteration to give the bread itâ€™s best chance at a good rise. I proved the yeast in warm water with sugar for 10 min before adding it to the flour mixture. I also let it rise for 30 minutes for the first rise and gave it 15 minutes for a 2nd rise. It turned out beautifully!

This recipe is terrible. There are steps missing. This dough does not rise because there are steps missing. Read all the comments. You have to proof the yeast and the recipe says nothing about it. Also, the rising is way too short. Nothing to punch down if you donâ€™t proof the yeast.
This has become my favorite go to recipe!

Made a couple modifications - started with tepid water and then sprinkled yeast on top and let sit for 5 minutes. I just didn't think the yeast would activate well if I followed the directions. Otherwise followed recipe and ended up with a tender, flavorful and light foccacia. I am thinking that if I had just followed the recipe I would have gotten a denser loaf, which might have been the intention of not putting the yeast in warm water.
